page.title: 06PORTHCAWL-Religion
page.content: There are only 4 places of worship in this rectangle of Porthcawl-All Saints Church,Weslian Methodist Church, Congregational Church and a Gospel Mission Hall.There are however many more in the area, in fact nearly all the Non-Conformist Churches are represnted here as well as th Roman Catholic Church and the Church in Wales. All Saints Church in Church Place had its roots in a Sailors Mission near the old dock.The congregation grew so rapidly that the building became inadequate,so the congregation moved to new buildings in Lias Road(became the National School).Finally in 1891 All Saints Church was constructed, originally entirely of iron,later converted into stone for Â£10,000.
